alert.note: Alert for Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 12 at 8:44AM CDT until June 12 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CDT FOR JOHNSTON...NORTHWESTERN BRYAN...SOUTHERN COAL...SOUTH CENTRAL PONTOTOC...MARSHALL AND SOUTHWESTERN ATOKA COUNTIES... At 843 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Pontotoc to 3 miles northeast of Tishomingo to 5 miles west of Madill, moving southeast at 45 mph. The storm with the greatest potential for large hail was located near Madill. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Madill, Tishomingo, Kingston, Dickson, Mannsville, Ravia, Wapanucka, Lehigh, Silo, Mill Creek, Milburn, Kenefic, Bromide, Mead, Clarita, Olney, Fillmore, Reagan, Connerville, and Pontotoc. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
